Bug.Summery: [Model Sync] Preference page uses model provider name
Bug.WithStack: The preference page for enabling/disabling model content uses the model provider label but should consult the team content extension point. This will have to do for now since we need to load the modle provider to get the UI name. We'll need to change this in 3.3 so we can get the name from the team content descriptor. Added a getName to ITeamContentProviderDescriptor - which will return whatever name is used in the plugin.xml for the teamContentProvider extension point. If no name is specified then it will fall back to the old behaviour. Verified in I20061031-0656
Bug.WithOutStack: The preference page for enabling/disabling model content uses the model provider label but should consult the team content extension point. This will have to do for now since we need to load the modle provider to get the UI name. We'll need to change this in 3.3 so we can get the name from the team content descriptor. Added a getName to ITeamContentProviderDescriptor - which will return whatever name is used in the plugin.xml for the teamContentProvider extension point. If no name is specified then it will fall back to the old behaviour. Verified in I20061031-0656

Bug.Summery: [Intro] Circles theme text panels too wide on mac
Bug.WithStack:
I20060328-0010
When inside a welcome page (e.g. Overview), you can see a bar at the top with the other pages you can navigate to. If you hover on one of them, a white panel with text appears. On the mac, the white panel is too long, and covers two items. The result is that if you move your mouse to the right and try to hover on the next one, you won't see its text because you're still on the first one which was covering it.
Screenshot explains it better... Created attachment 37103 screenshot There is no plan to fix this. The new "Slate" theme does not have this problem.

Bug.Summery: [evaluation] Content assist in details pane does not recognize char[] array

Lines.Line: 2. Give focus to details pane, typed "CTRL+Space". Content assist thinks that b is just an object and does not provide methods/fields for an array.

Bug.WithStack:
1. From the Variables View, select "b" 2. Give focus to details pane, typed "CTRL+Space". Content assist thinks that b is just an object and does not provide methods/fields for an array.
If I type this.<Ctrl + Space>, content assist recognizes "b" as an array and will show methods and fields for an array.
I think this is a side effect of the details pane not being able to recognize an array. To do evaluation for an array, I must type this.<something>. For other classes, like String, I do not have type "this." to do my evaluation.
Testcase: String a = new String("abcde"); char[] b = a.toCharArray(); "this" is working as designed. An array is an object, but there is no "receiver" class for an instanceof an array, so we allow "this" to be used as a feature - see bug 25362 (i.e. there is no Java type char[] to perform code assist in, just char[]). In the Java language, there is no place where "this" refers to an array, as you can't write methods in "array types".
Not sure we can do better. Needs investigation. Deferred As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
1. From the Variables View, select "b" 2. Give focus to details pane, typed "CTRL+Space". Content assist thinks that b is just an object and does not provide methods/fields for an array.
If I type this.<Ctrl + Space>, content assist recognizes "b" as an array and will show methods and fields for an array.
I think this is a side effect of the details pane not being able to recognize an array. To do evaluation for an array, I must type this.<something>. For other classes, like String, I do not have type "this." to do my evaluation.
Testcase: String a = new String("abcde"); char[] b = a.toCharArray(); "this" is working as designed. An array is an object, but there is no "receiver" class for an instanceof an array, so we allow "this" to be used as a feature - see bug 25362 (i.e. there is no Java type char[] to perform code assist in, just char[]). In the Java language, there is no place where "this" refers to an array, as you can't write methods in "array types".
Not sure we can do better. Needs investigation. Deferred As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [Intro] Restore defaults on welcome prefs page switches tabs
Bug.WithStack:
I20060328-0010
Go to the Welcome preference page, switch to Overview tab and change things around. Then hit Restore Defaults. It brings you back to the Home tab. I was hoping to see the changes I made undone, but I lost context when it switched tabs. Restore will remove all the page tabs and recreate them from the preference store. As a result, the selection will switch to the only page that will remain (the home page). What I can do is remember the currently selected page and restore this selection after the pages have been added (providing that that page is still selected). There is no plan to fix this.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20060328-0010
Go to the Welcome preference page, switch to Overview tab and change things around. Then hit Restore Defaults. It brings you back to the Home tab. I was hoping to see the changes I made undone, but I lost context when it switched tabs. Restore will remove all the page tabs and recreate them from the preference store. As a result, the selection will switch to the only page that will remain (the home page). What I can do is remember the currently selected page and restore this selection after the pages have been added (providing that that page is still selected). There is no plan to fix this.

Bug.Summery: [Model Sync] Misleading No Changes message
Bug.WithStack:
In the case where no model providers are enabled, and we perform a sync that has some incoming or outgoing changes: We get the helpful "There are no Outgoing changes for the Java Workspace. However File System Resources has changes in the Outgoing mode." message complete with the hyperlink to switch modes.
The problem is that when you click on the link you get the same message for the other mode. We should enable the model provider detailed in the link if the user clicks on the hyperlink. Fixed Verified
Bug.WithOutStack:
In the case where no model providers are enabled, and we perform a sync that has some incoming or outgoing changes: We get the helpful "There are no Outgoing changes for the Java Workspace. However File System Resources has changes in the Outgoing mode." message complete with the hyperlink to switch modes.
The problem is that when you click on the link you get the same message for the other mode. We should enable the model provider detailed in the link if the user clicks on the hyperlink. Fixed Verified

Bug.Summery: [FieldAssist] ContentAssistField: proposal popup and additional info should have different bg color

Lines.Line: a) use the system default color for the proposals list (white on WinXP)
b) Platform/UI adds the colors for the proposal popup to the Colors and Fonts preferences page and offers API to retrieve the default colors

I don't see (b) happening in any 3.2 timeframe. Typically we try to use the same defaults as platform text's implementation. Opened bug #133731 to consider the idea of exposing colors and other defaults as user preferences.

Bug.WithStack:
I20060328-0010
ContentAssistField's proposal popup and additional info should have different background colors. They currently have the same yellow background (I guess the system info bg color, but the info color is not really suitable for the list).
The Java editor already lets the user configure the proposal list colors (Preferences > Java > Editor). I think the colors should be the same in the Java editor and in the editor's Find/Replace dialog.
2 solutions: a) use the system default color for the proposals list (white on WinXP) b) Platform/UI adds the colors for the proposal popup to the Colors and Fonts preferences page and offers API to retrieve the default colors I don't see (b) happening in any 3.2 timeframe. Typically we try to use the same defaults as platform text's implementation. Opened bug #133731 to consider the idea of exposing colors and other defaults as user preferences.
(a) is a very reasonable suggestion. System info background is the default color used by PopupDialog. ContentProposalAdapter$ContentProposalPopup could override this to use the normal system background color. Just to make sure this is not forgotten: the system default background color should be accompanied by the system default foreground color then. yes, both colors will be set. There are methods in place to allow a PopupDialog subclass to do this. Changed to use the LIST_FOREGROUND and LIST_BACKGROUND colors. Fixed >20060411. verified in I20060413-0100, WinXP
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20060328-0010
ContentAssistField's proposal popup and additional info should have different background colors. They currently have the same yellow background (I guess the system info bg color, but the info color is not really suitable for the list).
The Java editor already lets the user configure the proposal list colors (Preferences > Java > Editor). I think the colors should be the same in the Java editor and in the editor's Find/Replace dialog.
2 solutions: a) use the system default color for the proposals list (white on WinXP) b) Platform/UI adds the colors for the proposal popup to the Colors and Fonts preferences page and offers API to retrieve the default colors I don't see (b) happening in any 3.2 timeframe. Typically we try to use the same defaults as platform text's implementation. Opened bug #133731 to consider the idea of exposing colors and other defaults as user preferences.
(a) is a very reasonable suggestion. System info background is the default color used by PopupDialog. ContentProposalAdapter$ContentProposalPopup could override this to use the normal system background color. Just to make sure this is not forgotten: the system default background color should be accompanied by the system default foreground color then. yes, both colors will be set. There are methods in place to allow a PopupDialog subclass to do this. Changed to use the LIST_FOREGROUND and LIST_BACKGROUND colors. Fixed >20060411. verified in I20060413-0100, WinXP

2. Go to File -> New -> New Report
3. In the "New Report" wizard, enter a report name and click "Next"
5. Enter a "Display Name", "Description", and a "Template Image" path.

Bug.Summery: custom item width is remembered after MeasureItem listener has been removed

Lines.Line: - press the "Pack..." button to pack column 0
- press the "Add..." button to add a MeasureItem listener that specifies a larger width for the item's column 0
- press the "Pack..." button and note that column 0 grows, which is expected as a result of the listener
- press the "Remove..." button to remove this MeasureItem listener
- press the "Pack..." button and note that column 0 does not shrink to its previously-packed width

Bug.Summery: [FieldAssist] auto activation of proposal popup should be canceled on keystroke

Lines.Line: => after a few "r"s, the proposal popup appears at the last "r" inserted

Bug.WithStack:
I20060328-0010
Auto activation of the proposal popup should be canceled on keystroke.
Steps: - open Find/Replace dialog, activate regex - type "\rrrrrrr" as fast as possible => after a few "r"s, the proposal popup appears at the last "r" inserted
This is not the intent of the "auto activation with delay" feature. Auto activation is intended to help the user if he stops typing and starts to think about possible completions.
It should be triggered when the user types "\" and then waits a while, but the popup should not appear when the user continues typing after the trigger character. The proposal is that if another key is hit before the popup is opened, then the popup should never open. This is reasonable. Fixed >20060411 verified on I20060413-0010.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20060328-0010
Auto activation of the proposal popup should be canceled on keystroke.
Steps: - open Find/Replace dialog, activate regex - type "\rrrrrrr" as fast as possible => after a few "r"s, the proposal popup appears at the last "r" inserted
This is not the intent of the "auto activation with delay" feature. Auto activation is intended to help the user if he stops typing and starts to think about possible completions.
It should be triggered when the user types "\" and then waits a while, but the popup should not appear when the user continues typing after the trigger character. The proposal is that if another key is hit before the popup is opened, then the popup should never open. This is reasonable. Fixed >20060411 verified on I20060413-0010.

Bug.Summery: access restriction errors too eager
Bug.WithStack:
3.2M5a
I want to rule out the use of HashSet (to eliminate non-determinism, we moved all our code to LinkedHashSet, which is a subclass of HashSet).
In 3.1 the restriction was OK. In 3.2M5a the error seems too eagerly reported.
It complains about LinkedHashSet<Integer> s= new LinkedHashSet<Integer>(); s.add(2); //complains here
I'd like to have an option to make it not complain here - there's no direct access to HashSet in the code) not a big deal since it actually resulted in better code:
Set<Integer> s= new LinkedHashSet<Integer>(); s.add(2); //ok now Might be related to bug 76266. In 3.2, we did propagate access restriction on members, and thus though you restricted access to HashSet, you are still using its members indirectly through inheritance.
There are situations where this is simply wrong (think of public class extending an internal one, and you want to prevent reaching inside by mistake). This however feels like #add() is part of the standard contract to use. We discussed this, and post 3.2 we may want to consider method overriding/implementing public contracts to be considered as non restricted. Will look at it post 3.2. LATER is deprecated.
Bug.WithOutStack:
3.2M5a
I want to rule out the use of HashSet (to eliminate non-determinism, we moved all our code to LinkedHashSet, which is a subclass of HashSet).
In 3.1 the restriction was OK. In 3.2M5a the error seems too eagerly reported.
It complains about LinkedHashSet<Integer> s= new LinkedHashSet<Integer>(); s.add(2); //complains here
I'd like to have an option to make it not complain here - there's no direct access to HashSet in the code) not a big deal since it actually resulted in better code:
Set<Integer> s= new LinkedHashSet<Integer>(); s.add(2); //ok now Might be related to bug 76266. In 3.2, we did propagate access restriction on members, and thus though you restricted access to HashSet, you are still using its members indirectly through inheritance.
There are situations where this is simply wrong (think of public class extending an internal one, and you want to prevent reaching inside by mistake). This however feels like #add() is part of the standard contract to use. We discussed this, and post 3.2 we may want to consider method overriding/implementing public contracts to be considered as non restricted. Will look at it post 3.2. LATER is deprecated.

Bug.Summery: [constraints] error messages with more context
Bug.WithStack:
When reporting a constraint violation (or more generally, an issue) we need to know more context. For example, if I have several CheckComponents in the workflow and I have an error, I want to see which of the components (and maybe, which .chk file and in which line) the constraint was evaluated. This could be implemented using a utility extension is then stdlib.
For example, loc() tries to compute a sensible string that provides the context in the model (element of type SAZ named XYZ owned by ABC).
We could provide another extension (CONLOC, for constraint location) that constructs a string with the constraint file and the line. this is a new feature This bug has been moved to www.openArchitectureWare.org/bugzilla. Bug.Summery: Please add "do not ask again" to "errors in project" dialog
Bug.WithStack:
I20060328-0010
I need to run several hundred snippets for testing, and there are errors in the project because some of the snippets won't compile on the current platform. It is getting pretty tedious telling the dialog that yes, I do want to launch, even though there are errors in the project. OK - I found the preference. But it would be nicer if I could have clicked on a checkbox in the dialog to tell it not to ask again, and the dialog could have set the preference for me. A checkbox doesn't work because a user that chooses not to launch as well as don't ask me again would end up having launches cancelled with no notification. Really need three buttons: No - cancels the launch Yes - continues the launch (default button) Always - sets the preference and continues the launch. Created attachment 37337 add an Always button
will release after M6 ships. released patch to HEAD Mike, please verify verified, changed the order of the buttons to 'always', 'yes', 'no' and added a mneumonic for the always button

I just ran the adopter scan tool, and I could not reproduce the problem that you saw. Here's what I did:
1. Unzip WTP + prereq and the scan tool 2. Launch Eclipse 3. Check out the adopter_usages folder 4. Check out the org.eclipse.jst.common.annotation.core plugin 5. So this could be a intermittent problem. Do you have some procedures on how to reproduce this problem reliably? Thanks. John, over to you. Thanks. I'm closing as invalid since the last report says it can not be reproduced. Please reopen if this is still an issue.

Bug.Summery: Dependency Management Section does not update icon on target platform reload
Bug.WithStack:
If the Manifest Editor is open, when the user changes the target platform, any plugin no longer found in the new target platform should be marked with a red X. This happens in the require-bundle list. Unfortunately, the dependency management section does not listen to this event. Created attachment 37119 patch
Registered Dependency Management section to listen for IModelProviderEvents from ExternalModelManager and WorkspaceModelManager. wouldn't it be better to listen to changes in PluginModelManager? Created attachment 37128 patch
Sounds like a good idea to me. Since I based the listener off of the RequireSection code, I included an update to that code in this patch also. Now they both implement IPluginModelListner (and listen to the ModelManger) instead of IModelProviderListener. patch applied. thanks. closing.

Bug.Summery: Feature request for J9 debug target
Bug.WithStack:
J9 allows the addition and removal of methods and static fields during a hot code replace. As a result, certain field and method IDs can be created or invalidated during the HCR.
I would like the Eclipse debugger to re-reqeust field and method IDs for any class which has undergone HCR the next time a query is made for them (e.g. displaying variables in a stack frame). This is already done - when a type is hot swapped, its cached type info is removed and recreated from the backend when needed.
Marking as works for me, unless there is a specific bug with this.
Bug.WithOutStack:
J9 allows the addition and removal of methods and static fields during a hot code replace. As a result, certain field and method IDs can be created or invalidated during the HCR.
I would like the Eclipse debugger to re-reqeust field and method IDs for any class which has undergone HCR the next time a query is made for them (e.g. displaying variables in a stack frame). This is already done - when a type is hot swapped, its cached type info is removed and recreated from the backend when needed.
Marking as works for me, unless there is a specific bug with this.

Bug.Summery: [Model Sync] Need better handling for no model syncs

Lines.Line: a) Present the entire list of available models (but all in the unchecked state). Any model selected from the list will reactivate that model.
b) Provide some indication of why there are no models available and what the user can do to rectify the situation.

I think we should have a checkbox that says 'Show all models" if any or all of the models are disabled (and if the are all disabled we should check the box by default). I don't think this is vital for 3.2 so I'm deferring until 3.3.

Bug.WithStack:
If the user disables all models (for whatever reason) and chooses 'Synchronize With Models', he will be presented with an empty list.
To make this more user friendly we need to either:
a) Present the entire list of available models (but all in the unchecked state). Any model selected from the list will reactivate that model.
b) Provide some indication of why there are no models available and what the user can do to rectify the situation. I think we should have a checkbox that says 'Show all models" if any or all of the models are disabled (and if the are all disabled we should check the box by default). I don't think this is vital for 3.2 so I'm deferring until 3.3. Fixed in HEAD Verified in I20061031-0656

Bug.Summery: [validation] Missing "=" in attribute values of HTML tags not being validated
Bug.WithStack:
To reproduce, open a JSP editor and overwrite the contents with the html below. Note that there is a missing '=' in the bgcolor attribute of the body tag. Behaviour seen in I20060323.
<%@ page language="java" contentType="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" pageEncoding="ISO-8859-1"%> <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"> <html> <head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1"> <title>Insert title here</title> </head> <body bgcolor"#DDDDDD">
</body> </html> Not reproducible in 3.2. That is to say, there is an error message reported on this in WTP 3.2 There is a warning, but it's just a coincidence that #DDDDDD is not an attribute value. If we had done bgcolor"bgcolor", no problem would have been generated. I think it's worth investigating still. Created attachment 181861 Validator patch for missing "=" after Attribute name
Validation added to check for missing "=" after Attribute name. A new Preference has also been added in Web->HTML->Validation->Attribute section to set the severity level At its current implementation, any attribute that has an empty value is flagged with a warning. I revised this to check for the ITextRegion for the equals sign.

To reproduce, open a JSP editor and overwrite the contents with the html below. Note that there is a missing '=' in the bgcolor attribute of the body tag. Behaviour seen in I20060323.

</body> </html> Not reproducible in 3.2. That is to say, there is an error message reported on this in WTP 3.2 There is a warning, but it's just a coincidence that #DDDDDD is not an attribute value. Bug.Summery: Client Side Parameter Validation
Bug.WithStack:
It will be nice to have a client side parameter validation. This will allow to filter out / display validation error before hitting the database.
Consider the following scenario ... I have a report, which takes some begining date and ending date as the parameter and goes to database and retrives a bunch of values. Right now there is no way to validate the format / contents of date paramter. It will be much helpful to have a mechanism to validate and to display error (at the client side). Currenlty the (sneaky) work around is to use String as the data type and write your own Java / JavaScript logic to validate the input for the appropriate format.
I discussed this with Mr. Scot Rosenbaum and Mr.Jason Weathersby during EclipseCon 2006 and they also agreed that this is a valid enhancement. Consider adding script support at report parameter level, such as ClientValidate(parametervalue) script and serverValisate(paramValue, AppCOntext) for each report parameter. Pass the client script to the browser requester page, and call the server side script with the engine scripting scope in viewer's server side JSP pages after the parameters are submitted to viewer from browser.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 132883 ***

Bug.Summery: Background not painting properly for tree columns in varaibles view
Required attributes on tag lib instance tags not being validated
Bug.WithStack:
In the HTML below, there is missing 'var' attribute on the loadBundle tag. The TLD for loadBundle defines 'var' as a required attribute, so if you try to run this JSP on a server you will get an exception stating there is missing required attribute. <%@ taglib uri="http://java.sun.com/jsf/core" prefix="f"%> <%@ taglib uri="http://java.sun.com/jsf/html" prefix="h"%>

Please enter your name and password, mm.

Name:

Created attachment 37127 A roughed out fix wrapped in a plugin project for easy demo I have written a roughed out IValidator to detect this problem. Don't know if a general taglib validator would be a good idea in the future or not although I can see there are probably other things that could be validate in this category. Very likely to be a dupe of bug 133642 in that they seem to be ignored completely. Not a dupe in the sense that 133642 describes validation behaviour which exists for some elements (i.e. HTML) but not others (i.e. taglibs). This bug is specific to taglibs and would not make any sense out side that domain AFAIS. Also, note that taglibs are not ignored completely. For example, if you put a JSP EL region in the attribute value for a tag, it will be validated for syntax. However, I could see where a broad fix might address both issues. I'm going to mark this a duplicate of bug 160548 (it mentions this missing required attributes problem along with undefined attributes) Thanks for the proposed fix. The actual fixed checked in pretty similar to what was proposed. *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 160548 *** The bug that is marked as a duplicate for this one includes more cases, so this should only be seen as a verification of the one original case I raised in this particular bug report. Verified in RC0. Closing as verified.

Bug.Summery: [Undo] Should IOperationApprover be involved with context removal/disposal of a context
Bug.WithStack:
Given two contexts, A and B, with undo limits of 5, and the following operations executed on the history: B, (AB), A, A, A, A, A, A
When 5 operations have been executed in the A context, preceeding ones are flushed from the history, or in the case of op (AB), the A context is removed from the operation. The user now has the following in the history:
B, B, A (5 times)
The user attempts to invoke undo from context B, and is incorrectly allowed to undo the operation which originally affected both A and B contexts. The problem is that other changes have occurred in A which make it impossible to undo that operation. Do you have a specific use case/example code to demonstrate the problem or are you referring to a theoretical problem? I'm asking because in the current SDK use cases this is not an issue.
If A were text edits and B were workspace-level operations, and one of the B operations involved the document edited by A, then the validation for the workspace-level operation would know that A had subsequently changed and disallow the operation. If A were workspace-level operations and B were text edits, when A got purged from the (AB) op, the op would detect this and replace itself with a local text edit for B.
In other words, specific mechanisms/validation schemes tend to catch these kind of cases, so I don't know of a case where this presents a problem today. Also, the operation history never assumes a linear undo model, so it would never decide on its own to treat this as a special case. It's up to either the operations themselves or operation approver mechanisms to figure this out, and so far they do.
Marking "normal" severity until there is a use case demonstrating the problem. reassigning to UI from runtime > I'm asking because in the current SDK use cases this is not an issue.
It's "theoretical". I saw a bullet on your eclipsecon slide about supporting undo levels per context. It sounded tricky, so I took a look at the code and saw this issue. It still seems like a bug, even if a specific use case in the SDK has a workaround which masks it.
> If A were text edits and B were workspace-level operations, and one of the B > operations involved the document edited by A, then the validation for the > workspace-level operation would know that A had subsequently changed and > disallow the operation.
This seems like duplication of a check that the operation history should be guaranteeing, using the default linear undo.
> If A were workspace-level operations and B were text > edits, when A got purged from the (AB) op, the op would detect this and replace > itself with a local text edit for B.
I don't think operations in general will morph when a context is removed from them.
> In other words, specific mechanisms/validation schemes tend to catch these kind > of cases, so I don't know of a case where this presents a problem today.
Right, the only way to know would be to check every client of the operation history framework. The client's expectation is that by default linear undo is guaranteed, and by tagging operations with contexts, no validation is needed. >> If A were text edits and B were workspace-level operations, and one of the B >> operations involved the document edited by A, then the validation for the >> workspace-level operation would know that A had subsequently changed and >> disallow the operation.
>This seems like duplication of a check that the operation history should be >guaranteeing, using the default linear undo.
Actually, model change validations more rightfully belong in the operation's validation code. It is not a duplicate or workaround. Consider the case when there is no editor open on A (and therefore no undo history). The workspace-level operation still needs to know when A changes (for any reason) and invalidate itself in that case. The validation code is not checking whether the history is linear, but whether anything affecting the operation has changed. By assuming the operation history handles this validation, you are assuming every possible modification to A would participate in undo (which would be nice, but is unlikely).
>The client's expectation is that by default linear undo is >guaranteed, and by tagging operations with contexts, no validation is needed. This can never be guaranteed. A client would have to know that every possible change to a model object generates an undo. In an open world, any plug-in could violate this premise and so it is generally not a safe assumption. If an operation depends on a certain model state for its undo, it should be checking this state. The API further documents that linear undo is never assumed at the operation history level.
I agree there is a potential hole in your scenario, but my gut feeling is that once necessary validation is added to operations, these cases are generally already caught.
> >This seems like duplication of a check that the operation history should be > >guaranteeing, using the default linear undo. > Actually, model change validations more rightfully belong in the operation's > validation code. It is not a duplicate or workaround. Consider the case when > there is no editor open on A (and therefore no undo history). The > workspace-level operation still needs to know when A changes (for any reason) > and invalidate itself in that case. The validation code is not checking > whether the history is linear, but whether anything affecting the operation has > changed.
Not quite. When editor A closes, it flushes its context. This should remove all operations which depended on the A context, *including* AB. To make this work, we should be consulting the IUndoApprover as part of flushing context A. If the approver says that AB can not be undone (which is a valid question, because the subsequent A ops will never be undone), then AB must be flushed also. If B preceeding AB can not be undone, it needs to be flushed, etc. If the approver is linear, then the entire history (B, (AB), A, A, A, A, A) would get flushed. This is the correct behavior. If there were a "C, (CB)" at the beginning, they would get flushed too.
This bug is basically the same as another bug related to executing operations that can't be undone. Some argued that the preceeding history should be flushed. It causes the same cross-context problem unless flushing is done correctly.
> By assuming the operation history handles this validation, you are > assuming every possible modification to A would participate in undo (which > would be nice, but is unlikely).
No, I'm simply assuming that the history has performed the validation implied by its API, approver, and the existence of contexts.
> >The client's expectation is that by default linear undo is > >guaranteed, and by tagging operations with contexts, no validation is needed. > This can never be guaranteed.
Sure it can. I could be writing an RCP app where I'm the only one changing stuff, and I know I always use operation. Or, the TEXT framework guarantees this by tracking its document, and if for any reason the document is modified outside of an operation, they create one on-the-fly. If somehow a client grabs the TextStore and screws with it, they are hosed and their operations don't have any way of detecting this.
> A client would have to know that every possible > change to a model object generates an undo. In an open world, any plug-in > could violate this premise and so it is generally not a safe assumption. If an > operation depends on a certain model state for its undo, it should be checking > this state.
This would require every operation to two complete copies of the model it affects, and run checks to ensure consistency on undo or redo. The TEXT framework does not do this. When they undo an operation, they assume that the buffer contains the same characters it did when the operation was originally executed.
> The API further documents that linear undo is never assumed at the > operation history level. > I agree there is a potential hole in your scenario, but my gut feeling is that > once necessary validation is added to operations, these cases are generally > already caught.
You can not validate every scenario, since it would require expensive copies. Furthermore, the approver is a validation mechanism already in place.
Please forget about the specific refactoring and text editing scenarios, and take a generic look at the API that has been defined. If I have:
B, (AB), A, A
The linear approver will say "no, you can't undo (AB)". It doesn't then make sense to execute a few more As, and all of a sudden the approver says, "sure, now you can undo (AB)". The approver has now violated its job. If this is correct behavior, and operations are supposed to catch this scenario, then I don't understand the purpose of approvers or contexts.
I'm pretty sure that the best solution to this bug, and the solution to purging the history when a non-undoable operation has been executed (don't recall that bug #), would be to consult the approver(s) as part of the flush, rather than only at the time of undo. The idea of using IOperationApprovers to validate additional modifications to the history (such as removal of contexts, etc.) is an interesting one, and should be investigated for 3.3. I am renaming the bug to reflect this, as this is not specific to undo limits.
cc'ing Linda in case she has any interest or comment in this possible feature.
Not to beat a dead horse, but...I still maintain that checking integrity of the model affected by an operation is necessary, and a side effect of this integrity checking is that the cases you describe are generally caught anyway.
>The TEXT >framework does not do this. When they undo an operation, they assume that the >buffer contains the same characters it did when the operation was originally >executed. The text framework does not make this assumption. It does integrity checking by checking the modification stamp of the document at the time the command was performed. If it does not match, the operation is considered to be invalid and undo is not allowed. In this way it *does* detect cases where someone mucked with the text store and the undo manager did not know. Granted, when dealing with legacy plug-ins that do not support modification stamps, it does have to be more optimistic.
>Not quite. When editor A closes, it flushes its context. My point is that if A is changed elsewhere, without a text editor ever being open, (such as by replacement in CVS, etc.) this case must be detected by any operation relying on the content of A. Modification stamps and the like can be used for this, there is no need to make copies. Unless every plug-in modifying A participates in undo, this validation will always be necessary. > The text framework does not make this assumption. It does integrity checking > by checking the modification stamp of the document at the time the command was > performed. If it does not match, the operation is considered to be invalid and > undo is not allowed. In this way it *does* detect cases where someone mucked > with the text store and the undo manager did not know.
If I grab the text store directly and modify it, the document doesn't know and the timestamp stays the same. OK, that horse is dead.
> >Not quite. When editor A closes, it flushes its context. > My point is that if A is changed elsewhere, without a text editor ever being > open, (such as by replacement in CVS, etc.) this case must be detected by any > operation relying on the content of A.
Now you're talking about resource changes in the workspace and I agree that operation that operate on resources need to be guarded for unexpected resource changes (which are more likely than someone grabbing the text store). I was thinking more about the case when contexts A and B refer to working copies of documents (i.e. in memory). You generally have more control over your working copies than you do resources in the workspace. I agree that this is a problem waiting to happen.
I think I avoided running into this issue by the nature of the undo contexts that are assigned to the GMF operations. In GMF, each diagram editor operates on its own EMF editing domain, and there are no operations that 'span' editing domains. In short, I don't (presently) have any case where the history can look like:
B, (AB), A, A
This would become an issue, however, if a client decided to write a diagram editor that used a different kind of undo context. For example, if the undo context for their editor was an EMF resource, then there would most likely be operations that affect more than one resource in the same editing domain.
As an alternative to using IOperationApprovers to implement the linear undo model, I observe that IOperationHistory#operationChanged() is not used when contexts are flushed from undoable operations through the operation history. If it were, clients implementing the linear undo model (e.g., UndoActionHandler) could listen for this notification and flush the transitive closure of all operations with intersecting contexts. Just a thought...
> If it were, clients implementing the linear undo model (e.g., > UndoActionHandler) could listen for this notification and flush the transitive > closure of all operations with intersecting contexts. Just a thought...
You don't want to flush the entire history of an intersecting context. You only need to flush starting at the point of intersection going back. It is still ok to allow undo up until the point of intersection. investigate for 3.3 removing 3.3 milestone. This wasn't necessary for implementing resource-based undo, and we won't be making behavior changes to the framework at this point without a high prio use case. This message is part of a mass update...the bug is likely legitimate, but not a priority. Marking P5. Patches would be entertained.
As per http://wiki.eclipse.org/Platform_UI/Bug_Triage_Change_2009
Bug.WithOutStack:
Given two contexts, A and B, with undo limits of 5, and the following operations executed on the history: B, (AB), A, A, A, A, A, A
When 5 operations have been executed in the A context, preceeding ones are flushed from the history, or in the case of op (AB), the A context is removed from the operation. The user now has the following in the history:
B, B, A (5 times)
The user attempts to invoke undo from context B, and is incorrectly allowed to undo the operation which originally affected both A and B contexts. The problem is that other changes have occurred in A which make it impossible to undo that operation. Do you have a specific use case/example code to demonstrate the problem or are you referring to a theoretical problem? I'm asking because in the current SDK use cases this is not an issue.
If A were text edits and B were workspace-level operations, and one of the B operations involved the document edited by A, then the validation for the workspace-level operation would know that A had subsequently changed and disallow the operation. If A were workspace-level operations and B were text edits, when A got purged from the (AB) op, the op would detect this and replace itself with a local text edit for B.
In other words, specific mechanisms/validation schemes tend to catch these kind of cases, so I don't know of a case where this presents a problem today. Also, the operation history never assumes a linear undo model, so it would never decide on its own to treat this as a special case. It's up to either the operations themselves or operation approver mechanisms to figure this out, and so far they do.

Bug.Summery: Can't debug Eclipse applications from self-hosting workspace

Lines.Line: - It only fails on my self-hosting workspace.
- In a clean workspace it works fine.
- Launch normal Java apps is fine, but Eclipse apps or PDE Junit apps fail
- The error message just says "Cannot connect to VM"

Bug.WithStack:
Build id: I20060328-0010
Sorry to enter this without reproducible steps, but I can't launch an Eclipse application in debug mode using this build. Some data points:
- It only fails on my self-hosting workspace. - In a clean workspace it works fine. - Launch normal Java apps is fine, but Eclipse apps or PDE Junit apps fail - Restarting/rebuilding doesn't fix it - The error message just says "Cannot connect to VM"
In the log is the following exception:
java.net.SocketException: socket closed at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(PlainSocketImpl.java:384) at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(ServerSocket.java:471) at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(ServerSocket.java:442) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportService.accept(SocketTransportService.java:93) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.accept(SocketTransportImpl.java:56) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:128) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:78) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:816) I just noticed that this appears in the console:
VMJ9VM007E Command-line option unrecognised: -agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,suspend=y,address=localhost:1924 Could not create the Java virtual machine.
I don't see where this "agentlib" argument is specified in the launch configuration... The command line is generated for you to debug (agentlib is an expected argument for debugging on a 1.5 VM or higher).
Likely a dup of bug 128605. If you're using an IBM, it changes your PATH environment variable. This causes Eclipse to find the wrong dlls when attempting to debug a remote VM that is of a different version than the host VM. In my case I'm using the same VM for both my development and test workspaces (the same IBM 1.4 VM for both). If I revert to Eclipse I20060315, then everything works fine. So, something has changed in Eclipse in the past two weeks that is causing this to fail. if you see "agentlib" on the debug target properties, it sounds like you're using a 1.5 VM to debug. Otherwise, we use -Xrunjdwp:.... Turned out to be a combination of bug 87039, and the new feature for bug 124045. The old bug had the VM pegged as "java version" 2.2, when it was really 1.4. The new feature changes the command line when the version is > 1.4, to properly support debug options. If you've detected JREs since 3.1, this will not happen.

Bug.Summery: SVG charts has null namespace
Bug.WithStack:
The grouping tag in the generted SVG charts is an empty string. This should not be an empty string but the namespace of the svg specification.
An empty namespace causes errors when transcoding the svg to a staic image. Add namespace to document elements in generated SVG output. Closing
Bug.WithOutStack:
The grouping tag in the generted SVG charts is an empty string. This should not be an empty string but the namespace of the svg specification.
An empty namespace causes errors when transcoding the svg to a staic image. Add namespace to document elements in generated SVG output. Closing

Need an XPath function wizard that will help in creating XPath expression. Think of the M$ Excel function wizard here. There is some collateral that we can add to so jump start this effort (ready meta data files, concepts, etc). We decided against the XPath function wizard, but rather, to use context sensitive editor help to cycle between variables/functions/templates.

Bug.Summery: Need an import wizard for BPEL 1.x to 2.0
Bug.WithStack: As discussed before, the editor will edit and save only BPEL 2.0 files. However, import of 1.x BPEL sources ought to be possible. An import wizard needs to be written. This could take on a simple XSLT type format initially. I know it is not going to cover everything but even a good 90% jump start is a good thing. Consider this one for a future, major release. "Version" must be the product version number where this bug was first discovered - it can't be a "future" version.
Bug.WithOutStack: As discussed before, the editor will edit and save only BPEL 2.0 files. However, import of 1.x BPEL sources ought to be possible. An import wizard needs to be written. This could take on a simple XSLT type format initially. I know it is not going to cover everything but even a good 90% jump start is a good thing. Consider this one for a future, major release. "Version" must be the product version number where this bug was first discovered - it can't be a "future" version.

Bug.Summery: [View Management] Inconsistent showing of run menu items
Bug.WithStack:
Once the debug view is shown it adds the debug action set to the run menu, which stays there for perspectives like Java and Plugin Development. In some cases though it is removed, while still leaving the JDT action set.
E.g. see the run menu in the CVS perspective; the debug items are removed (suspend, resume, etc) but the JDT items are still there (add watchpoint, etc).
These items should not appear in perspectives they do not apply to. This is working as expected - the jdt debug action set is associated with certain parts being open (java editor, etc). So, if an editor has focus then the action set appears to allow it to be launched.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Once the debug view is shown it adds the debug action set to the run menu, which stays there for perspectives like Java and Plugin Development. In some cases though it is removed, while still leaving the JDT action set.
E.g. see the run menu in the CVS perspective; the debug items are removed (suspend, resume, etc) but the JDT items are still there (add watchpoint, etc).
These items should not appear in perspectives they do not apply to. This is working as expected - the jdt debug action set is associated with certain parts being open (java editor, etc). So, if an editor has focus then the action set appears to allow it to be launched.

Bug.Summery: Integration with Eclipse Callisto Simultaneous Release
Bug.WithStack: The goal of the Callisto Simultaneous Release is to release ten major Eclipse projects at the same time to support the needs of the ecosystem members who integrate Eclipse frameworks into their own software and products. Callisto is about developers helping developers serve the whole Eclipse community. This project will ensure that BIRT is integrated with the Callisto Simultaneous Release. BIRT is part of the Callisto release starting 2.1M5. Fixed in 2.1M5.

Bug.Summery: [Model Sync] Add help to Sync Preferences

Lines.Line: 1) The Team>Models preference page does not have any F1 help.

2) The Preferences dialog for the Synchronize view (found in the view menu) does not update the help pane when a new tab is selected. It would be nice if it did. I assume it is possible since the Windows>Preferences dialog does it.
F1 help for Team > Models preference page
Patch for point 1) in comment 2 released.
I do not see any clear way of updating help pane.

Bug.WithStack:
We need to provide some help for the Sync pref dialog. There are two aspects I would like to see addressed:
1) The Team>Models preference page does not have any F1 help.
2) The Preferences dialog for the Synchronize view (found in the view menu) does not update the help pane when a new tab is selected. It would be nice if it did. I assume it is possible since the Windows>Preferences dialog does it. Created attachment 67228 F1 help for Team > Models preference page Patch for point 1) in comment 2 released. I do not see any clear way of updating help pane.
The preferences dialog for the Synchronize View are displayed in org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.dialogs.PreferencePageContainerDialog.java which has his own help. For some reason help set from PreferencePage does not work, so I think I should get help context from preference page and set it in the preferencePageContainerDialog (cannot be done without PreferencePage API modification). I had a look at the org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.PreferenceDialog class and it implements an IPageChangeProvider. It seems that help listens to page chang events from a dialog and adjust the content of the help pane based on the current page. I wonder if we could get what we want by having PreferencePageContainerDialog implement IPageChangeProvider and have the dialog fire a page change event whenever a new tab is selected. Created attachment 67433 Synchronize View help
I did as you suggested and it works pretty well except the initail state.
I really have no idea what put where to dispaly correct help for initial help view. The patch looks good. As for the initial case, I looked in the WorkbenchHelpSystem#setHelp method and what it is doing is is calling addHelpListener on the control. Instead of calling the setHelp method, you could add a help listener yourself that, when triggered, invokes the performHelp() method on the currently visible page. Created attachment 67779 Synchronize View Preferences Help This is not vital for 3.3 so I'm deferring it to 3.4. Patch released The Patch Synchronize View Preferences Help (attachment 67779) looks fine, except one thing: Workspace and Startup tabs have the same (seems to be default) help content i.e. "Each workbench window contains one or more perspectives, which are made up of various views and editors.".
As for the other patch (attachment 67228), which adds F1 help for Team > Models preference page I've got one concern: I'm able to open the help pane which is still filled with an inappropriate content (see the following attachment).
Created attachment 75540 Help for Team > Models with wrong content Reopening to investigate failure case identified in comment 11. Fix released to HEAD Verified in I20070917-1300.

Bug.Summery: New option to 'Recreate Modified class files in Output Folder'

Lines.Line: - default workspace setting ('Java Compiler > Building > Rebuild...' unchecked)
- change a class file in the text editor
- disable project-specific settings on 'Java Compiler > Building' page
- change a class file in the text editor
Can you file a new bug against jdt.core?

Bug.WithStack:
Please see bug 129082.
JDT/Core has added a new option in M6 to JavaCore called CORE_JAVA_BUILD_MAKE_OUTPUT_FOLDER_CONSISTENT that needs to be surfaced in the UI.
From JavaCore.getDefaultOptions() * BUILDER / Make Output Folder(s) Consistent * Indicate whether the JavaBuilder should check that the output folders * are consistent while performing incremental build operations. If changes * are detected to managed .class files, then a full build is performed. * - option id: "org.eclipse.jdt.core.builder.makeOutputFolderConsistent" * - possible values: { "enabled", "ignore" } * - default: "ignore" Renamed the option to:
org.eclipse.jdt.core.builder.recreateModifiedClassFileInOutputFolder=enabled
BUILDER / Recreate Modified class files in Output Folder Indicate whether the JavaBuilder should check for any changes to .class files in the output folders while performing incremental build operations. If changes are detected to managed .class files, then a full build is performed, otherwise the changes are left as is. Tools further altering generated .class files, like optimizers, should ensure this option remains set in its default state of ignore.
*** Bug 133804 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Any suggestions for the label in the prference page?
My suggestion would be: 'Detect and rebuild class files modified by others' Adding Philippe for brainstorming about the label. Maybe simply 'Rebuild class files modified by others' (detect is implicit) Both sounds good to me. Being a bit verbose there is likely a good idea. The pref should go under the Java>Compiler>Building>Output folder area. new UI released > 20060329
used Jeromes suggestion 'Rebuild class files modified by others' Reopening. The preference is still enabled when I disable project-specific settings:
- default workspace setting ('Java Compiler > Building > Rebuild...' unchecked) - set project-specific setting to checked - change a class file in the text editor -> automatically recompiled (good) - disable project-specific settings on 'Java Compiler > Building' page - change a class file in the text editor -> automatically recompiled -> expected: no recompile Can you file a new bug against jdt.core? verified in I20060330-0010
The option is there Problem is that UI does not remove the project-specific setting. Created attachment 37303 Fix Fixed UI problem in JavaBuildConfigurationBlock. Filed bug 134064 for a core problem with the new feature. Verified in I20060330-2000.

Bug.Summery: Improve distribution and installation of BIRT
Bug.WithStack: Users of BIRT, especially new users, can sometimes be overwhelmed by the complexity of the installation of BIRT and all the components that it depends on. BIRT 2.1 aims to improve the end user experience of downloading and installing BIRT and all of its related components. new features and packages has been created to componentized BIRT distribution. Also created third party packages to host thrid party packages. a new all-in-one packages are also created to reduce the number of downloads. Update manager package is now also supported.
Bug.WithOutStack: Users of BIRT, especially new users, can sometimes be overwhelmed by the complexity of the installation of BIRT and all the components that it depends on. BIRT 2.1 aims to improve the end user experience of downloading and installing BIRT and all of its related components. new features and packages has been created to componentized BIRT distribution. Also created third party packages to host thrid party packages. a new all-in-one packages are also created to reduce the number of downloads. Update manager package is now also supported.

Bug.Summery: JSP syntax validation doesn't update markers
Bug.WithStack:
Copy the html below into a JSP editor. Note that the editor should immediately flag a syntax error related to the </body> tagging missing a ">".
However, saving, building or validating the file or project will never cause the error to translate into markers on the navigator tree or in the Problems view.
Behaviour seen in I20060323.
<%@ page language="java" contentType="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" pageEncoding="ISO-8859-1"%> <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"> <html> <head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1"> <title>Insert title here</title> </head> <body> </body </html> I am seeing TONS of odd behaviors and mis-validation in I200603302119 build --- XML Content is where I saw it.
Markers left, markders not produced, red squigglies not produced.
Something is amiss.
I've noticed that the validation builder is not added to some of my projects. Without the validation builder there is no validation on save. I also noticed that sometimes errors show up as warnings and then on subsequent validation they will show up as errors (without making changes to any files). Something's off.
David - Which red squiggles are not produced. I found a regression in this week's IBuild where some XSD validation squiggles are not produced. This will be fixed for next week in a change Valentin has submitted. It seems to me, the immediate problem is just the way HTML Validator is defined in the plugin.xml. Perhaps we haven't "kept up" with other changes in validator default assumptions? (Either that, or its been broken for a long long long time!).
Changing the current <run enabled="true" class="org.eclipse.wst.html.internal.validation.HTMLValidator"> </run> to <run async="true" fullBuild="true" incremental="true" enabled="true" class="org.eclipse.wst.html.internal.validation.HTMLValidator"> </run>
seems to fix the problem.
Nitin, Amy, will you please review this fix? I'll commit to head, but not release until I get some sanity check from you.
Vijay, can you please comment on this issue too?
Can you do a 5 minute review of our org.eclipse.wst.html.internal.validation.HTMLValidator and see if there's any reason it does not satisfy
async="true" fullBuild="true" incremental="true"
I didn't really notice any difference with the fix. Validation is still flaky for me. The scenario in the description seems to work sometimes in jsp files and never in html files. Nitin, I'm going to put this on your queue, as it seems to "go with" bug 116119 and bug 130399. Hope you can find a general theme that solves all of them.
*** Bug 143213 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 130399 *** I'm not sure this is exactly a duplicate of 130399. My issue was that as-you-type validation of HTML (and it seems to affect other implementors of the source validation ext-pt) does not seem to update problem markers. It does introduce squigglies in the editor, but does not add a marker in the editor, navigator or problems view.
Problem still reproducible in wtp-sdk-S-1.5RC5-200606161055. Cameron, as-you-type validation does not create markers. You have to have validation enabled during builds or manually validate the file to create markers. Lowering priority pending a response. > Cameron, as-you-type validation does not create markers. You have to have > validation enabled during builds or manually validate the file to create > markers.
Is there any plan to have the two types of validation merge in 2.0? The problem I see here is that there are certain very important diagnostics, like HTML syntax validation, that only get validated "as-you-type". So if I have a web project with a broken jsp/html file, the only way I can will know is if I open every file or if I happen to hit it at runtime. As far as I know, there is only 1 as-you-type validation that is not registered with the validation builder framework, and that's the markup validator. HTML syntax validation should be the same for both validation. And the difference would be one validates the saved file, and one validates the dirty/saved file currently in the editor.
I believe there is an issue with the markers not always updating when you have the file open, but if the file is closed and you right-click the file and Validate that way, are you still not seeing errors? It looks like you are correct. Is this issue logged elsewhere? What's the target milestone?
Yes, as bug 143213. It will have to wait until 2.0 at this point as I think it will require nontrivial changes. *** Bug 126433 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Created attachment 58949 org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.patch
As Nitin stated in bug 143213, the validation adapters can only report errors to 1 reporter at a time, and they were only being reported to the source validation reporter when batch validation was being ran.
The current validation code actually tries to set the validation reporter to the appropriate one before calling validate. The problem was that the setting of the reporter wasn't being propogated. The attached patch makes sure to set the reporter to propogating validators. Patch looks good to me, handing it off to Amy since she's done the work. Fix was checked in and released for this week's WTP 2.0 M5 build. Verified the original case is fixed in WTP2.0RC0.
However, new cases found during verification. See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=187702. Closing as verified.

Bug.Summery: GC construction is very slow on the Mac when a Display is passed in
Bug.WithStack:
The Mac version of Display creates a *new window* every time a GC is constructed on it.
For example:
Display d = Display.getDefault(); GC gc = new GC(d);
This causes the following chain of calls on the Mac: GC(d)-->d.internal_new_GC()-->d.createOverlayWindow()-->OS.CreateNewWindow()
This means that creating and disposing of GCs frequently (inside the same method, for instance) is very slow on the mac, if you pass in a Display object rather than a Control or some other Drawable. This seems like a bug, since GCs seem intended to be created and destroyed frequently.
This is not a problem on Windows or (as far as I can tell from a cursory inspection) Linux. We fixed this, right? No, it is not fixed. We still create the window, we only avoid showing it until some drawing happens. Fixed > 20060420 Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
Bug.WithOutStack:
The Mac version of Display creates a *new window* every time a GC is constructed on it.
For example:
Display d = Display.getDefault(); GC gc = new GC(d);
This causes the following chain of calls on the Mac: GC(d)-->d.internal_new_GC()-->d.createOverlayWindow()-->OS.CreateNewWindow()
This means that creating and disposing of GCs frequently (inside the same method, for instance) is very slow on the mac, if you pass in a Display object rather than a Control or some other Drawable. This seems like a bug, since GCs seem intended to be created and destroyed frequently.
This is not a problem on Windows or (as far as I can tell from a cursory inspection) Linux. We fixed this, right? No, it is not fixed. We still create the window, we only avoid showing it until some drawing happens. Fixed > 20060420 Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

Bug.Summery: [Forms] FormToolkit should mention border surpression
Bug.WithStack:
What if you want a text control on a form that has no border at all? This is appropriate where you want text that is read-only but selectable with the mouse.
There is a way ...
text.setData(FormToolkit.KEY_DRAW_BORDER, Boolean.FALSE);
but the documentation doesn't include the notation that Boolean.FALSE suppresses the border, only that some other values can be used to ADD borders when the toolkit is not inclined to supply them by default. I assume this is referring to the javadoc in the org.eclipse.ui.forms plugin. Yes.
Dejan, folks tell me that you're handling this area...if not just punt back.
Created attachment 104713 patch to update javadoc
I took a look at the code to confirm the described behaviour. Will add this to the javadoc for 3.5. Patch applied to HEAD for 3.5.

Bug.Summery: Not prompted to switch prespectives when breakpoint hit.
[Help] Help button on New Plug In Project Dialog does not work if opened from a cheat sheet
Bug.WithStack:
Open the cheat sheet entitled "Create a feature and Update site using PDE. Work your way to the step "Creating the plug-in project" and press the click to perform button. The new plug-in project dialog is opened with the cheatsheet attached to the right of the dialog. Hit the help (?) button.
Expected result, help opens where there used to be a cheat sheet. Actual result, no help is displayed.
Note that this sequence works fine.
Hit File->New->Project, then select "Plug Projects" and press the "?" button in the new plug in project dialog. This brings up the help page whose first sentence is "This wizard helps you create a new plug in project" Bug is still in 3.3RC4 *** Bug 173716 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This is working in I20110424-2000
Bug.WithOutStack:
Open the cheat sheet entitled "Create a feature and Update site using PDE. Work your way to the step "Creating the plug-in project" and press the click to perform button. The new plug-in project dialog is opened with the cheatsheet attached to the right of the dialog. Hit the help (?) button.
Expected result, help opens where there used to be a cheat sheet. Actual result, no help is displayed.
Note that this sequence works fine.
Hit File->New->Project, then select "Plug Projects" and press the "?" button in the new plug in project dialog. This brings up the help page whose first sentence is "This wizard helps you create a new plug in project" Bug is still in 3.3RC4 *** Bug 173716 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This is working in I20110424-2000

Bug.Summery: Determine Columns Bound To A Table
Bug.WithStack: In order to improve application performance, the report developer needs to be able to tell what columns from a dataset have been bound to a table. This will allow the developer to then optimize the SQL statement. For example, if only 2 columns from a dataset with 10 columns have been bound, then the select list does not need to fetch all 10 columns from the database. This reduces the data fetch thereby improving performance. Looks new data binding framekwork provides this info. The data binding structue has been changed. Users can manager the binding with data set columns by themselves.
Bug.WithOutStack: In order to improve application performance, the report developer needs to be able to tell what columns from a dataset have been bound to a table. This will allow the developer to then optimize the SQL statement. For example, if only 2 columns from a dataset with 10 columns have been bound, then the select list does not need to fetch all 10 columns from the database. This reduces the data fetch thereby improving performance. Looks new data binding framekwork provides this info. The data binding structue has been changed. Users can manager the binding with data set columns by themselves.

Bug.Summery: Tree PaintItem event has wrong x

Lines.Line: - run the snippet below, which draws a focus box with the event's bounds for each item

- note that beyond the root level of depth the focus box does not move to the right with the item that it's giving the PaintItem coordinates for, so client code that uses the event's x to determine where to draw its custom contents will paint at the wrong place

Bug.Summery: Upgrades to the ODA 3.0 design framework
Bug.WithStack:
BIRT 2.1 will incorporate enhancements to the Open Data Access component of the Data Tools Project such as: Upgrades to the ODA 3.0 design framework; specialized implementation in oda.jdbc.ui to support the DTP textual SQL Editor and exposed database definition model; utilizing the java.sql.Connection obtained via the DTP ODA runtime framework if the connection properties reference an external connection profile; embedding and launching the ODA custom designer's wizard and editor pages in the data explorer. Most of the listed features are targeted for BIRT 2.1, and are listed in existing Bugzilla entries.
The feature on integrating the oda.jdbc driver is deferred to after BIRT 2.1. "specialized implementation in oda.jdbc.ui to support the DTP textual SQL Editor and exposed database definition model; utilizing the java.sql.Connection obtained via the DTP ODA runtime framework if the connection properties reference an external connection profile"
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 131056 *** Another related Bugzilla entry: 131055.

Most of the listed features are targeted for BIRT 2.1, and are listed in existing Bugzilla entries.
The feature on integrating the oda.jdbc driver is deferred to after BIRT 2.1. "specialized implementation in oda.jdbc.ui to support the DTP textual SQL Editor and exposed database definition model; utilizing the java.sql.Connection obtained via the DTP ODA runtime framework if the connection properties reference an external connection profile"
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 131056 *** Another related Bugzilla entry: 131055.

Bug.Summery: [Memory View] Edit failed - Data is invalid
Bug.WithStack:
While scrolling around the memory view the cell editors get activated. Closed the memory view while a cell editor was active and got an error message telling me the edit had failed because the data was invalid.
Also noticed that the memory view applies edits when I leave Eclipse. I scrolled around the view a bit, then moved from Eclipse to Firefox, when I returned to Eclipse it had marked the cell as if I had manually changed the value even though I had never intentionally done so and the new value was the same as the old value. Deferred. Will consider after 3.2. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
While scrolling around the memory view the cell editors get activated. Closed the memory view while a cell editor was active and got an error message telling me the edit had failed because the data was invalid.
Also noticed that the memory view applies edits when I leave Eclipse. I scrolled around the view a bit, then moved from Eclipse to Firefox, when I returned to Eclipse it had marked the cell as if I had manually changed the value even though I had never intentionally done so and the new value was the same as the old value. Deferred. Will consider after 3.2. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: greatbug - Callisto removes SVN Team features
Bug.WithStack:
After installing Callisto, it is not possible to access Team menu on a project so to synchronize it with Subversion, using Subclipse. Worse, in the Team Synchronizing perspective, the synchronization doesn't work correctly. After unstinalling Callisto, everything behaves normally.
Conclusion: as is, Callisto cannot be used in development/production.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 130571 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
After installing Callisto, it is not possible to access Team menu on a project so to synchronize it with Subversion, using Subclipse. Worse, in the Team Synchronizing perspective, the synchronization doesn't work correctly. After unstinalling Callisto, everything behaves normally.
Conclusion: as is, Callisto cannot be used in development/production.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 130571 ***

Bug.Summery: [api request] resource adapter import/export
Bug.WithStack:
In our code we import/export the resource adapters programatically, to do this properly, we have a dependency on the following internal APIs:
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.RARFile; org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.jca.ui.internal.wizard.ConnectorComponentImportWizard org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.CommonarchiveFactory org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.helpers.ArchiveOptions org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.jca.operations.ConnectorComponentImportDataModelProvider org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.jca.operations.ConnectorComponentExportDataModelProvider
Since import/export of resource adapter is a rather common operation, we believe that these APIs should be made public. *** Bug 133687 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Moving these enhancements to 301 for now Shall we put this in the 3.1 plan? If they are going to get done, we need to do these before API freeze.
Bug.WithOutStack:
In our code we import/export the resource adapters programatically, to do this properly, we have a dependency on the following internal APIs:
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.RARFile; org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.jca.ui.internal.wizard.ConnectorComponentImportWizard org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.CommonarchiveFactory org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.helpers.ArchiveOptions org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.jca.operations.ConnectorComponentImportDataModelProvider org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.jca.operations.ConnectorComponentExportDataModelProvider
Since import/export of resource adapter is a rather common operation, we believe that these APIs should be made public. *** Bug 133687 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Moving these enhancements to 301 for now Shall we put this in the 3.1 plan? If they are going to get done, we need to do these before API freeze.

Bug.Summery: [import/export] ConnectorComponentImportWizard
Bug.WithStack:
In our tools we launch ConnectorComponentImportWizard to give users ability to import resource adapters. To do that, we have to use the following internal class.
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.jca.ui.internal.wizard.ConnectorComponentImportWizard
For re-use purposes we think that this class should be made external. This API was included in your other list.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 133686 ***

Bug.Summery: API request for NewServerWizard

source_code.code: /** * Open the new server wizard. * * @param shell a shell to use when creating the wizard * @param typeId a module type id, or null for any module type * @param versionId a module version, or null for any version * @param serverTypeId a server runtime type, or null for any type * @return true if a server was created, or * false otherwise * @since 2.0 */
public static boolean showNewServerWizard(Shell shell, String typeId, String versionId, String serverTypeId);

Bug.WithStack: In our tools we allow users to create new server instances. To do that we use the following internal class org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.wizard.NewServerWizard We believe that this is rather common scenario and for re-use purposes this internal class should be externalized Already past API freeze for WTP 1.5 release. Will investigate again for 2.0. Just changing "keyword" to allow better queries. Checked with Leho and they currently use the default constructor, but would prefer a way to show only certain types of servers. Plan to complete this for WTP 2.0 M5. New API released to 2.0 M5 builds. Bug.Summery: [Help] Links in help are missing icons
Bug.WithStack:
I20060328-0010
I used to see an icon to the left of links in help docs for those links that do things in the workbench (i.e. command links). I no longer see the icons, but instead a blank space where the icon should be. If the intention was to remove the icon, there shouldn't be a blank space.
See screenshot.. Created attachment 37140 screenshot It is possible that the image has not been exported when building (should check build.properties for org.eclipse.sdk). Fixed by adding the image to build.properties.
Note though that we will need to switch from this solution to using the 'img' tag in the code itself. The image needs to be inlined to flow well. Also the background image is dropped by IE in the high contrast accessability mode (unlike content image that stays). I think you meant 3.2 M6.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20060328-0010
I used to see an icon to the left of links in help docs for those links that do things in the workbench (i.e. command links). I no longer see the icons, but instead a blank space where the icon should be. If the intention was to remove the icon, there shouldn't be a blank space.
See screenshot.. Created attachment 37140 screenshot It is possible that the image has not been exported when building (should check build.properties for org.eclipse.sdk). Fixed by adding the image to build.properties.
Note though that we will need to switch from this solution to using the 'img' tag in the code itself. The image needs to be inlined to flow well. Also the background image is dropped by IE in the high contrast accessability mode (unlike content image that stays). I think you meant 3.2 M6.
